critique: The document focuses on the reinstatement of Mr. Dingley and emphasizes his qualifications and the benefit to the government. The tone is formal and bureaucratic. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and assurance in the decision-making process and the competence of the individual being reinstated. There is a slight element of joy that the right person is being placed in the right position. There is no indication of sadness, anger, fear, or disgust. There might be a slight surprise that an exception is being made to the rule, but it is framed as being in the best interest of the government.
